videoSnippet.title: Insane Preparation | Carlsen vs MVL | Grenke Chess Classic 2018.
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Check out the interview with Carlsen here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rDKMv96Oz7M

Check out the interview with MVL here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbY9h_IbZYo

Check out Round 4 Impressions video here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YDXPW6M1uJc

Magnus Carlsen vs Maxime Vachier-Lagrave
GRENKE Chess Classic (2018), rd 4, Apr-04 
Zukertort Opening: Sicilian Invitation (A04)

1. Nf3 c5 2. c4 Nc6 3. Nc3 e5 4. e3 Nf6 5. d4 e4 6. d5 ef3 7. dc6 fg2 8. cd7 Bd7 9. Bg2 g6 10. b3 Bg7 11. Qd6 Qb6 12. Qb6 ab6 13. Bb2 Bc6 14. O-O Ke7 15. Nd5 Bd5 16. cd5 Rhg8 17. d6 Kd6 18. Rad1 Ke7 19. Be5 Rgd8 20. Bb7 Rd1 21. Rd1 Rd8 22. Rd8 Kd8 23. Kf1 Ne8 24. Bg3 Kd7 25. a4 f5 26. f3 Ke6 27. Bc8 Kd5 28. Bb7 Ke6 29. Bc6 Nd6 30. Bf2 Be5 31. h4 f4 32. ef4 Bf4 33. a5 ba5 34. Bc5 Nf5 35. Bb6 Bd2 36. Bd8 Nd4 37. Ba4 Kd6 38. Kg2 Ne6 39. Bb6 Nc5 40. Bc5 Kc5

The 2018 GRENKE Chess Classic is a 10-player round-robin held in Germany from 31 March to 9 April. The first 3 rounds are in Karlsruhe alongside the GRENKE Chess Open, then after a rest day the last 6 rounds are in the Kulturhaus LA8 in Baden-Baden. The field features World Champion Magnus Carlsen and fellow Top 10 players Fabiano Caruana, Maxime Vachier-Lagrave, Vishy Anand and Levon Aronian, as well as women's no. 1 Hou Yifan.

The time control is 100 minutes for 40 moves, then 50 minutes for 20 moves and then 15 minutes to the end of the game, with a 30-second increment from move 1. If players are tied for first place a rapid play-off will take place. Official website: www.grenkechessclassic.com
